page.title: 04Industry in Sparbrook B'ham
page.content: Over the past 900 years there have been many industries in Sparkbrook. Most have been to with agriculture,like making tools ot cleaning and curing meat. Over the past 150 years the city has spread and the farms have been replaced. Houses have been built for workers in the new factories. Opposite Ashid's house is a meat packing factory. Ashid's dad used to work in a box factory behind the main road. Behind Sobia's house there are two car body works and a toy making factory. On Bushra's road there is an english slaughterhouse. On Stoney Lane there is a Halal slaughtrerhouse. At the back of Conway School there used to be the Â£Embassy Sportsdrome.' During the Second World War it was used to build aeroplanes. In 1945 it was burnt to the ground.
